document_data.name: City Watch
document_data.mainbody:
File:Delzorin.png|thumb|300px|right|''A traffic warden gives directions at the corner of [[Delzorin Street]] and [[Whaelgond Way]].'']]
The City Watch performed everyday policing duties. They never acted outside the walls of the city They were a peacekeeping force, also responsible for solving crimes and apprehending criminals.

During particularly busy hours at important intersections, the Watch also employed traffic wardens to manage the flow of people and vehicles. Traffic wardens carried two flags: one blue, which signaled for traffic to proceed, and one yellow, which signaled for it to stop. They also employed whistles to call the attention of passersby, if necessary.
document_data.Organization:
The Watch's purpose was not only to enforce the law, but also to ensure the well-being of Waterdhavians. It had a centralized command led by the Commander of the Watch, who supervised three watchlords,{{Cite web/Candlekeep forum/Questions for Ed Greenwood (2004)/Ranks of the Waterdeep City Guard and City Watch}} or senior commanders: the Mage Civilar in charge of the [[wizard]] corps; the Senior Armsmaster, who was in charge of supplies and reported directly to the Commander of the Watch; and the Grand Civilar, who commanded the ward civilars and held the same rank as the Mage Civilar. The Commander of the Watch reported directly to the [[Open Lord]]. Each ward of Waterdeep was patrolled by a division of the Watch under the command of a ward civilar, or [[Generic City Watch major (Waterdeep)|major]], who oversaw all the senior civilars commanding the watch stations of their respective wards.{{Border box float | theme = | float = | contentalign = center | width = auto | styles = | content = {{Split table|lca=center|rca=center|caption=City Watch Ranks|captionstyle=font-size:larger;font-family:Georgia,serif;font-weight:bold;text-align:center; |leftheader=Rank | [[Generic City Watch patrolperson (Waterdeep)|Watchman/Watchwoman]] | ''Constable'' | [[Generic City Watch sergeant (Waterdeep)|Sergeant]] | ''Armar'' | [[Generic City Watch lieutenant (Waterdeep)|Lieutenant]] | ''Civilar'' | [[Generic City Watch captain (Waterdeep)|Captain]] | ''Senior civilar'' | [[Generic City Watch major (Waterdeep)|Major]] | ''Ward civilar'' }} ---- '''Senior Commanders'''
''Grand Civilar'' • ''Mage Civilar'' • ''Senior Armsmaster'' ---- '''''Commander of the Watch''''' }}Each guard post was commanded by a senior civilar or [[Generic City Watch captain (Waterdeep)|captain]], sometimes referred to as a rorden, who commanded a number of patrols. Senior civilars also performed duties as orsars, acting as envoys and prisoner escorts; and as guardswords, in charge of patrolling the docks and gates. Each patrol was headed by a civilar, or [[Generic City Watch lieutenant (Waterdeep)|lieutenant]], Typical patrol groups included one armar, or [[Generic City Guard sergeant (Waterdeep)|sergeant]], also known as a "sword", and two or more [[Generic City Guard private (Waterdeep)|constable]]s, also known as "blades" or watchmen/watchwomen.

document_data.Tactics:
When within the walls of Waterdeep, the City Watch typically patrolled in groups of four, with two patrolmen, one armar, and one civilar.

In calmer districts such as the [[Castle Ward of Waterdeep|Castle Ward]], those detachments were even smaller, often consisting of only two officers. Conversely, locations such as the [[Dock Ward of Waterdeep|Dock Ward]] were patrolled by groups of eight during the day and twelve at night.

Many spellcasters within the City Watch were trained in the use of the spell ''[[trembling horn]]'', which was developed for the organization by [[Thyriellentha Snome|Thyri Snome]]. It allowed watchmen place an invisible, magical tracer that caused alarm-like effects that were widely recognizable among the Waterdhavian populace.
document_data.Base of Operations:
The Watch's main base of operations was the [[Palace of Waterdeep]].

There were multiple City Watch posts in Waterdeep. They were usually not located on the main streets, but were all identified by a green and gold lantern that hung outside, permanently lit by a ''[[continual flame]]'' [[spell]]. These posts served as local headquarters, armories, stations for people to report crimes, and temporary jailhouses to hold prisoners until they were moved to a courthouse. Watch stations were always led by a captain.
document_data.Possessions:
[[File:Badge_of_the_watch-5e.jpg|thumb|200px|right|''A  captain's ''[[badge of the Watch]]''.'']]
Members of the City Watch typically wore [[leather armor|leather]] and [[chain mail|chain armor]] and carried sturdy rods like [[club]]s, [[short sword]]s, and [[dagger]]s.

In the 14{{th}} century [[DR]], City Watch captains carried an ''[[amulet of the Watch]]'', a [[magic item]] that allowed the wearer to summon reinforcements from the Watch or from the [[City Guard (Waterdeep)|City Guard]]. In the 15{{th}} century DR, officers who achieved the rank of captain were awarded a ''[[badge of the Watch]]'', a magic item that provided the wearer with additional protection against attacks and allowed the [[Open Lord]] to immediately know the wearer's location. Only the Open Lord could award ''badges of the Watch''.

In the late 14{{th}} century DR, some of the members of the Watch were given fashionable-looking ''[[cloak of protection versus evil|cloaks of protection versus evil]]'' by [[Khelben Arunsun]] and one of his apprentices who later opened his own shop that sold similar magic [[cloak]]s.
document_data.History: By [[1479 DR]], the [[City Guard (Waterdeep)|City Guard]] had been folded into the Watch, becoming a division of its organization.{{Cite digital book/Downshadow||1}} As the Guard was better equipped and trained, particularly dangerous tasks inside Waterdeep were given to the Guard instead, such as patrolling the [[Waterdeep/Sewers|sewers]] and [[Undermountain]].{{Cite digital book/Downshadow||7}}
